title: Rangers boss Steven Gerrard open to striker Defoe joining his backroom staff
text:
Rangers boss Steven Gerrard has revealed he is open to Jermain Defoe joining his backroom staff before he ends his playing career.

Defoe is still banging in the goals at club level - he's scored nine in just seven league goals this term - but Gerrard believes his goalscoring nous could also be vital off the pitch.

'We are certainly open to that side of Jermain,' Gerrard said to the Daily Record. 'I can help centre forwards, that's why I'm in the game.

Steven Gerrard says Jermain Defoe could become part of his backroom coaching team

'But Jermain will know certain situations in the game, certain things to look out for in that specific position - better than any coach in the world.

'He has a catalogue of knowledge that he can pass on.

'Whether that ends up being on our staff or elsewhere, I'd love to see him give something back to the game. But he still has so much to offer as a player.'

Defoe has scored nine goals in just seven league games for Rangers so far this season

Defoe joined Rangers on an 18-month loan deal from Bournemouth in January 2018 after making just eight appearances for the Cherries at the start of 2017-18.

The 37-year-old was recently involved in a car accident in Glasgow but emerged unscathed from the crash following Rangers' win over Aberdeen.
description: Rangers boss Steven Gerrard has revealed he is open to Jermain Defoe joining his backroom staff before he ends his playing career as he bids to tap into the striker's goalscoring nous.
